Pre-Game Insights: Hosts West Indies (WI) will be opening their T20 World Cup 2024 campaign with a showdown against associate nation, Papua New Guinea (PNG), on June 2, 2024, at the Providence Stadium, Guyana, at 8 pm IST.
The two sides have never played a T20I against each other, and their clash on June 2 would be their first-ever meeting in the 20-over format.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average first innings score at the venue in T20I encounters, starting from the onset of 2022, is recorded at 168, while teams tend to demonstrate a bent for batting second.
Spinners have exhibited supremacy here, maintaining an economy rate of just 6.94 in the 24 T20Is played in the aforementioned timeframe.

As for PNG, their objective would be to leave a lasting impression and disrupt certain presumptions. They possess the requisite experience, with ten of their members having participated in the 2021 edition. Furthermore, only four of their players are below the age of 25.
Viewers will be able to catch the match broadcasted on the Star Sports Network.
Users can watch the match on the Disney+Hotstar (app and website).
